name: places/ChIJ__8_A_ZZwokRoiGgc4UzOVY
adrFormatAddress: Pier 25, New York, NY 10013, USA

originalText.text:
Charting a cruise with Atlantic Yachting is an absolute must, especially if you want to sail out on on the Hudson and view NYC’s iconic skyline. The photos do not do justice to the experience.

For our tour, we had Captain John at the helm of Vitamin Sea. He was a great captain and a wealth of knowledge about NYC. Oh, for fun, ask why you should not bring bananas on a boat. ;)~

We scheduled a sunset cruise and passed many of the landmarks. My favorite part of the trip was sailing under the Brooklyn Bridge and around the Manhattan bridge.

I am so glad to have had the opportunity to sail with Atlantic Yachting.

originalText.text:
The real deal. I signed up for an ASA sailing course and practice classes with Atlantic Yachting, and everything so far has been perfect.

From the best customer service among 5 different NY/NJ sailing schools I contacted, to the passionate instructors who are personable, make the learning fun, yet leave nothing to chance, I would recommend Atlantic Yachting to anyone with even a passing interest in sailing.

text.text:

originalText.text:
After a terrible experience with Tribeca Sailing, my partner and I decided to take 103 with Atlantic Yachting; WHAT A DIFFERENCE!! We loved every second of it, the instructor Jonathan was great and covered absolutely everything the course was set to. The exam was a breeze thanks to his extensive and perfectly delivered explanations and hands-on experience.

I would 100% recommend Atlantic Yachting to anyone looking for Sailing lessons in NYC. And if you want a fun cruise charter Vitamin Sea for the evening, you will have the best crew and time!

originalText.text: Did the ASA 101 course with Atlantic. The scheduling was flexible and the instructors made the course both fun and informative (especially Eric, the skipper on our boat)! Highly recommended for a fun weekend on the water.

text.text: Did the ASA 101 course with Atlantic. The scheduling was flexible and the instructors made the course both fun and informative (especially Eric, the skipper on our boat)! Highly recommended for a fun weekend on the water.

originalText.text: I went on a cruise with a group of 5 people who all work professionally in hospitality, and we were blown away by Atlantic Yachting. It would be unbelievably easy for Jonathan and Dave to rely on the scenery to do the hosting for them, but every minor detail was so thoroughly thought out - from the position of the boat to optimize our view of the Statue of Liberty to the snacks we brought that they arranged on beautiful dishes. Any time a drink went empty, one our lovely hosts was there offering to grab another. It is easy to spend a lot of money in New York City, but hard to find something worth it. This is it.
